definition: to cry/to weep aloud/to crow/to hoot
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
lit. not to know whether to laugh or cry (idiom)/between laughter and tears
hunger cries and cold roars (idiom); wretched poverty
the cuckoo cries blood/fig. plaintive lament

sentences.english: The sound of the morning birds is the loveliest song.
sentences.chinese: 晨鸟的啼唱声是最动人的歌曲。

sentences.english: Outside her window she could see the green trees with birds singing .
sentences.chinese: 窗外，她看到树木葱葱，鸟儿啭啼。

sentences.english: Fu Xing Bude around, free windows learn Partridge sing.
sentences.chinese: 绕扶行不得，闲窗学得鹧鸪啼。

sentences.english: The birds on the sand bank are continually crying.
sentences.chinese: 沙坝的鸟儿依然在嚎啼。

sentences.english: Although he's less talented, won by sheer dogged persistence.
sentences.chinese: 他啼天赋郴高，但全凭坚韧赌毅力援得撂胜利。

sentences.english: Other gull, a few acoustic Wu cries, awakened me and all of the memories.
sentences.chinese: 彼岸鸥鸟，几声呜啼，惊醒了我所有的记忆。

sentences.english: No passengers had to make signs shadow, a Gang autumn partridge sing.
sentences.chinese: 过尽路牌无客影，一冈秋雨鹧鸪啼。

sentences.english: Outside her window she could see the tress with birds singing .
sentences.chinese: 窗外，她看到树木葱葱，鸟儿啭啼。

sentences.english: In spring flowers flutter household chaos, not the sound of classes Jie to sing.

sentences.english: After the TV program, ironic laughters spread everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 节目播出以后，一时间，啼笑声遍地开花。

sentences.english: I used all my fruit fruit, a Yen for your laughter.
sentences.chinese: 我用我所有的果果，换你的一颜欢啼。

sentences.english: The sudden silence was like that in a forest when twittering birds see an eagle .
sentences.chinese: 忽然一静，像林中的啼鸟忽然看见一只老鹰。

sentences.english: I've longed to know what he thinks of the fair birds singing.
sentences.chinese: 渴望知道他可想到鸟儿的啼啭。

oriole or various birds of the Sylvidae family including warblers

to scare a bird into flight
to chant/to recite/to moan/to groan/cry (of certain animals and insects)/song (ancient poem)
